description: On 17 March 2020, in Zambia, "A restriction has been imposed on all foreign travel, with the public being advised to reschedule all avoidable travel. Hygiene practices to promote infection prevention in all passenger vehicles, airplanes, marine transport, and other conveyances, and points of entry such as airports, harbors, railway stations, and ground crossings is emphasized."
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: 13 March 2020: The Government of Zambia is enforcing "Closure of Simon Mwansa Kapwepwe (Copperbelt province), Harry Mwanga Nkumbula (Southern Province) and Mfuwe (Eastern province) International Airports. All international flights have been rerouted to Kenneth Kaunda International Airport (KKIA), Lusaka."
target_geog_level: All countries

description: 13 March 2020: The Government of Zambia is enforcing "Closure of Simon Mwansa Kapwepwe (Copperbelt province), Harry Mwanga Nkumbula (Southern Province) and Mfuwe (Eastern province) International Airports. All international flights have been rerouted to Kenneth Kaunda International Airport (KKIA), Lusaka." UPDATE: All international airports in Zambia were reopened on Jun 25 after Harry Mwaanga Nkhumbula, Simon Mwansa Kapwepwe and Mfuwe Airports had been previously closed on March 17.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Zambia "Zambia will Monday( on May 11th) be shutting its border with Tanzania after the country witnessed the highest spike of Covid-19 infections on Saturday."
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: Zambia "Zambia will Monday( on May 11th) be shutting its border with Tanzania after the country witnessed the highest spike of Covid-19 infections on Saturday." UPDATE: Authorities in Zambia reopened the country's border with Tanzania at Nakonde to freight transport as of May 15. Citizens were still banned from crossing the border.
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
In Zambia, 14 March 2020: "The Government of the Republic of Zambia has established an Emergency Fund to provide resources for COVID-19
preparedness, surveillance and response."

description:
1 April 2020: Zambia "Government has commenced the recruitment of 400 doctors and over 3000 para-medicals to support the response; a driver relay system at ports of entry to ensure there is no disruption to the
supply of essential goods; incentives to be provided for all frontline staff serving on the response."
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Zambia, 1 April 2020: "Diagnostic capacity has been expanded to the Northern region. Tools, reagents and technical expertise have been provided to the Tropical Diseases Research Centre (TDRC) on the Copperbelt."
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 14 March 2020, "Zambia activated the National Public Health Emergency Operations Centre (PHEOC)"
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description:
14 March 2020: Zambia is enforcing "A mandatory requirement for the provision of adequate and accessible facilities for hand hygiene at all public places including shopping malls, markets and other trading places, restaurants, bars, bus stations, places of worship, schools, offices, and other congregate settings. Hand hygiene facilities should include soap
and running water, or alcohol-based hand sanitizers."
type_text: Mandatory requirements for the provision of adequate and accessible facilities for hand hygiene at all public places including shopping malls, markets and other trading places, restaurants, bars, bus stations, places of worship, schools, offices, and other congregate.

description: In Zambia, 14 March 2020: "A Call Centre has been established for the public to report concerns and also receive information on the disease. Dedicated Call Centre numbers are 909 (toll-free), 0953898941, 0964638726 and 0974493553."

In Zambia, 14 March 2020: "Specialized training for key healthcare workers and surge staff including immigration, customs, defense, security and point of entry personnel is being rolled out countrywide. Guidelines for
various aspects of preparedness and response have been developed and distributed to health facilities, including the private sector."

In Zambia, 14 March 2020: "Community engagement through radio, TV, and social media platforms, and distribution of Information Education and
Communication (IEC) materials is ongoing. Parliamentarians have also been engaged to facilitate and promote community awareness in their constituencies"
14 March 2020: Zambia enforces "Mandatory isolation of all suspected and confirmed cases of COVID-19."
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On 17 March 2020, the Minister of Health in Zambia announced; "We are restricting public mass gathering and social distancing mandated to prevent infections. Organizations within-country have been requested to
reschedule public events or use technology to advance their agenda.
We are engaging the Ministries of Education and Higher Education to
consider bringing forward closing dates."

In Zambia, 14 March 2020, the Ministry of Health issued a statement: "Social distancing of at least one meter is encouraged when an individual is showing respiratory symptoms such as cough and/or sneezing. Individuals showing such symptoms are urged to stay at home and avoid interacting with the public."
Zambian president Edgar Lungu on April 16,2020 has made it mandatory for every citizen in the country to put on a mask as they leave their houses to go to public places
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
